2sa5ppda0i704ltii4dmrng4jh.name: Caterpillar Information Session
2sa5ppda0i704ltii4dmrng4jh.description:
Join us for this presentation on the complex and fascinating work done by Caterpillar in the areas of electrification, hybrid, and autonomous systems. You will learn about Caterpillar’s business, career opportunities, and technologies. The presenters, former CMU students, will cover technical projects related to remote control and autonomy, hybrid energy storage, dual fuel engines and power systems. 

Caterpillar is the largest manufacturer of construction equipment, mining equipment, diesel and natural gas engine systems in the world. Cat is a Fortune 100 company with annual revenue of $55B and one of 30 in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Cat invests heavily in research and development of new technologies. Electronics, advanced controls, and autonomous systems are key areas of investment for Caterpillar. Cat employs over 2000 electronics and software engineers worldwide and was ranked #1 as “top employer in electronics” by Electronic Design magazine. 

Today, Caterpillar’s autonomous machines operate on numerous mine sites around the world. They can negotiate complex haul roads, maneuver through high traffic areas, and work with other autonomous machines to perform complex tasks. Join us for this presentation and take a look under the hood at the technology that drives “Big Cat.”

78nh6797jhej9t6vpae1v13de7.name: CMU + Salesforce Tech Talk
78nh6797jhej9t6vpae1v13de7.description:
Our Salesforce Technology team is defining the future of cloud computing and we're looking for the next generation of bright, ambitious, curious minds to join us as we continue to blaze new trails. Join us for a Tech Talk with our Principal Architect, Pat Helland, as he discusses how to build and maintain Web Scale Infrastructure. In his talk, "Too Big NOT to Fail" Pat considers the challenges of running a large datacenter with perhaps 50,000 servers. It turns out that servers fail regularly and when you have a lot of them, this becomes a routine and everyday occurrence. We will discuss hardware, software, datacenter, storage, operations, and software rollout as we consider what happens when stuff is constantly breaking and you are too big to NOT fail."

Afterward, you’ll get the chance to hear from a panel of former Salesforce tech interns to discuss their experience working at one of Fortune's Best Companies to Work For" and answer all of your questions about the kind of impactful internship experiences that could be in your future with Salesforce! Oh, and don’t worry, we know attending an evening event can mean skipping dinner - so we’re providing free food for all attendees! We can’t wait to see you there.

4v0qrvt14ttgnj6nje2ohct4es.name: Vatic Labs Tech Talk
4v0qrvt14ttgnj6nje2ohct4es.description:
At Vatic Labs, traders, AI researchers, and technologists collaborate to develop autonomous trading agents and develop cutting-edge technology and apply it to the financial markets. The nature of the problems we work on are challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top computer scientists and researchers to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. We are passionate about hiring the best and the brightest, empowering them with the tools and mentorship needed to be successful. Our environment is highly collaborative, fostering innovation and growth.

As a Quantitative Researcher: You will focus on researching, developing, and applying cutting edge AI/ML and statistical models that interact directly with the financial markets, collaborate with a diverse team of academic researchers that have several thousand citations in their fields of study, as well as many team members who have won medals at IMO (gold), IOI, AMC ICPC, and others.
As an Algo Trader: You will collaborate with a team of highly successful traders in the quantitative trading sector to build algorithmic trading systems that trade across global markets, develop and optimize trading models that have direct P&L impact for the firm.
As a Software Engineer: You will build innovative technology at the forefront of low latency and distributed computing systems, have the opportunity to work on technology at all levels of the stack including everything from low level system/network development to algorithmic development (C/C++ & Python on Linux) 

If this sounds exciting to you please visit our website www.vaticlabs.ai or come by and see us on campus!

5gd05e95ghkh5k0t8jrf8f7f1t.name: Samsara Tech Talk
5gd05e95ghkh5k0t8jrf8f7f1t.description:
Samsara is the leader in Industrial IoT. Our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy.
Samsara’s portfolio of complete Internet of Things (“IoT”) solutions combine hardware, software, and cloud to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations. We serve over 10,000 customers across diverse sizes and industries, from transportation and logistics to field services, food production, energy, construction, local governments, and manufacturing.
From mechanical engineering to hardware to software, we take pride in building an end-to-end experience that our customers love. Some highlights:
• Established leadership (previously led $1.2 billion acquisition of Meraki to Cisco)
• CEO Sanjit Biswas named 2018 Top CEO by Glassdoor
• VP Aidan Madigan-Curtis named a 2019 Top 50 Women in Technology
• #3 on LinkedIn's Top Startups of 2019
• Series F, $6.3B valuation
• Modern software stack (Go, React, Typescript, GraphQL)
• 100 billion data points collected annually
• 1000+ boba teas consumed monthly
About the tech talk
Every year, more than 4 million car accidents are caused by driver distraction. In this talk, we'll look at how computer vision and machine learning can be applied on vehicle dash cameras to prevent such accidents by augmenting drivers' ability to stay attentive.
For more information, check out samsara.com/careers. If you have any questions, please email campus-recruiting@samsara.com.
We look forward to meeting you!

7s3tqfhklu9lsqjoriooipprnu.name: GoDaddy Tech Talk
7s3tqfhklu9lsqjoriooipprnu.description:
Deep Learning for Predicting Domain Prices

Learn how GoDaddy uses neural networks to predict the price of domain names in the aftermarket. GoDaddy Domain Appraisals (GoValue) is available to millions of GoDaddy customers and provides estimated values to help both buyers and sellers more effectively price domains names. GoValue is 1.25x better at predicting past domain name sale prices than human experts.

This talk will explain the hybrid recurrent neural networks behind GoValue. We will discuss some of the practical aspects of scaling and deploying a sophisticated machine learning system. Finally, we will dive into recent research at GoDaddy that created a new neural network structure for outputting tighter prediction intervals than existing techniques.

Try GoDaddy Domain Appraisals for yourself:
https://www.godaddy.com/domain-value-appraisal

Speaker: Jason Ansel

Jason Ansel is Senior Principal Engineer at GoDaddy. He is a leader in the GoDaddy Machine Learning Team that uses deep neural networks to help our small business customers.

Jason received his PhD from MIT in 2013.

His dissertation focused on the boundary between machine learning, programming languages, and compilers.

12u5rgdbv8c5e5jejqjdenm10u.name: Data Science at Root
12u5rgdbv8c5e5jejqjdenm10u.description:
Car insurance based on how people drive, not who they are. Powered by data science.

Root is a car insurance company founded on the belief that people who drive well are less likely to get into accidents, and that those people should pay less for insurance. With that in mind, Root set out to reinvent a broken industry — an industry that was still assigning rates based primarily on demographics and had an archaic agent structure.

Root's core data science challenge is understanding driving behavior from smartphone sensor data. We have logged billions of miles and our datasets are growing at an exponential rate. Computational and statistical challenges abound.

We believe a large part of the insurance challenge can be solved with a principled quantitative framework, and we are committed to developing and deploying methods that draw upon modern tools from the statistical machine learning community. In addition to telematics risk-scoring, the data science team works on core problems in pricing, reserving, marketing, and elasticity modeling. The team applies rigorous data-driven methods to making decisions across the entire business.

Come and meet Matt Bonakdarpour (SCS 2009), our VP of Data Science, to hear how Root is using data to shape the future of car insurance.

Abstract :
Agriculture is undergoing a new revolution, using information and automation to improve the productivity of farms and help feed the world’s growing population. This talk will look at how John Deere is using concepts from computer vision, machine learning, robotics and data informatics to improve productivity and provide value to our customers. We will also talk about the employment and internship opportunities available at Deere and how you can work in this exciting area.


Speaker :
Stewart Moorehead is the Enterprise Perception System Architect working at John Deere’s Global Technology Innovation Network. His work looks at how computer vision and machine learning can be used in Deere’s products to improve performance and increase safety of highly automated and autonomous vehicle systems. He has worked on autonomous tractors for orchards, robotic lawn mowers and the R Gator a robotic utility vehicle. He has a Ph.D. in Robotics from Carnegie Mellon’s Robotics Institute.

Running Into a (Memory) Wall

Presented by: Brian Nigito
In this talk we'll discuss the idea of a "Memory Wall", where memory latency completely
dictates program performance. We explore the tools and techniques we use at Jane
Street to measure this, and see what it looks like for both a simple program and a real
application. While Jane Street has a strong focus on functional programming, we hope
this talk shows how we also dive deep into low-level systems.

Data Science at P&G is solving billion dollar problems with the speed of a startup and is backed by the scale of the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. Our goal is to win the consumers through the application of advanced machine learning and statistical algorithms to create superior products and optimize our marketing, sales, supply chain and business operations. Sharmila Arcot
IT Security Engineer

A
Ankita Mangal

1ub40dhrrt0l4s23vst95d5g7d.name: Clearwater - Healthcare Cyber Risk Management
1ub40dhrrt0l4s23vst95d5g7d.description:
Heinz College Students:

Digital transformation in healthcare is rapidly driving adoption of new technology and information systems to support key business initiatives. As a result healthcare data has been growing at 48% per year and the number of points from where that data can be accessed is growing exponentially.

These trends are creating demands such as:

• A greater need to secure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of protected health information

• The need for a comprehensive, enterprise wide Risk Analysis and Risk Management program that complies with OCR’s guidance

• And also, the need for a scalable cyber risk management system that adapts to the organization’s needs as they change

Unfortunately, there are challenges in meeting these market demands that put many organizations and their patients at unnecessary risk.

This presentation will discuss how Clearwater is helping leading healthcare organizations in adopting an ongoing programmatic approach to managing cyber risk.

In addition we will discuss what its like to be part of the Clearwater team going out and meeting these customers where they are, helping them understand and manage their cyber risk, as well as developing new and innovative solutions to address the ever changing threats they face.

53856pusg75pe14bt89kias4gf.name: Determined AI Info Session
53856pusg75pe14bt89kias4gf.description:
Join us to discuss the future of deep learning and the underlying AutoML research driving our product vision. Learn more about distributed systems and machine learning opportunities at Determined AI!

Co-founder/Chief Scientist and CMU MLD Professor Ameet Talwalkar will be joined by Determined AI engineers (and CMU PhDs) Aaron Harlap and Danny Zhu for an interactive discussion and Q&A.


About Determined AI

Founded in June 2017, Determined AI is an early-stage, venture-backed company at the forefront of machine learning technology. Deep learning has enormous promise, but developing practical applications powered by deep learning is extremely complex and expensive. We are making it faster, cheaper, and easier for companies to build intelligent applications. Our software provides workflow and infrastructure automation tools covering the entire model development lifecycle, with a specific focus on deep learning. Our customers are highly skilled ML engineers and domain experts working on exciting problems in biotech, hardware design, adtech, and more.

Our team

Our founders, Evan Sparks, Neil Conway, and Ameet Talwalkar, met at UC Berkeley's AmpLab, where they contributed to the Apache Spark, MLlib, and PostgreSQL open source projects. Ameet is also an organizer of the Conference on Systems and Machine Learning (SysML). Our engineering team includes PhDs from Carnegie Mellon University, UC Berkeley, University of Chicago, and University of Texas Austin; they have published extensively at top machine learning and systems conferences including NeurIPS, ICML, SysML, and SOSP.

1mpcqlbtk9nv6lo032c4mooqtr.name: Partnership for Public Service - Cybersecurity Talent Initiative Information Session
1mpcqlbtk9nv6lo032c4mooqtr.description:
The Partnership for Public Service is looking for motivated and mission-driven aspiring cybersecurity leaders to join the Cybersecurity Talent Initiative in the summer of 2020. This information session will serve as a chance for students to learn more about this program and connect with representatives from the Partnership for Public Service, corporate partners, and participating federal agencies.

The Cybersecurity Talent Initiative is the first-of-its-kind public-private partnership aimed at recruiting and training a world-class cybersecurity workforce. The program is a selective opportunity for students in cybersecurity-related fields to gain vital public and private sector work experience and even receive up to $75,000 in student loan assistance.

The fellowship entails a two-year placement within a federal agency during which participants will receive mentorship, professional development and leadership training from public and private cybersecurity leaders, while making a meaningful impact on the country’s digital security. Before the end of their federal service, participants will be invited to apply for in-demand positions with the program’s corporate partners. Participants hired by these companies will also receive student loan assistance.

30rhskdso2v01vs13ldlh8vqob.name: KPMG Ignition Tokyo: Information Session
30rhskdso2v01vs13ldlh8vqob.description:
Dear CMU Students.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be looking for new Interns from February 2020!

We are holding Information Session on October 8th from 18:00 at Carnegie Mellon University.

A Partner, Director, and Manager from KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be there to explain about our Internship program.

Please feel free to RSVP for joining the event!

< Internship Details >
1) Internship will be in KPMG Ignition’s office in Tokyo and the terms are either 6 or 8 months.
2) Internship will be fully paid with a housing allowance.
3) Employment visa application support also available.
4) Chance to receive a full time job offer after the internship.
5) Internship start date negotiable.

＜Position 1＞Engineer:
Intern students are expected to catch up with knowledge collateral for bleeding edge technologies and participate in programming activities for innovation. Each developer will have a chance to work in a wide range of projects experiencing the use of different technologies (AI and blockchain as the main). All projects worked on are for client delivery.

＜Position 2＞Business and Consulting Research:
Our analysts are responsible for designing and executing the qualitative and quantitative research approach across a wide range of industries and topic areas from consumer insights to disruptive technology trends.

Interns are expected to get involved in the entire innovation process and participate actively from initial visioning all the way through idea generation and follow up activities. Intern students will assist in project management, identifying stakeholder and client needs and bridging them with digital strategy. For this role being able to speak Japanese at a native level is must.

＜Position 3＞Blockchain / Secure Computing Engineering :
As a software developer you will work in a dynamic and evolving environment following the strategic direction of KPMG Japan. You will develop, maintain and improve systems to meet particular needs, often as advised by systems architect. You will also do testing, test automation and bug fixing. Our team develops digital solutions which involve cutting edge technology such as NLP, Machine Learning, OCR, Blockchain, IoT etc. We are particularly looking for blockchain specialized software developer.

＜What is KPMG Ignition Tokyo?＞
KPMG is a professional firm, providing audit, tax and advisory services in Japan. KPMG has more than 162,000 professionals in 155 countries and offers value-added services to address the management issues of our clients all over the world.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be the centerpiece of our firm’s digital strategy, merging our professional insights in audit, tax and advisory with the knowledge of our digital experts and the latest digital technology. It will support the digitalization of our own services as well as the digital transformation of our clients, and will be a center for developing the solutions necessary to succeed in an increasingly competitive global landscape.

Should you have any questions, please free to contact us.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo

_64qjee248d1k4b9k6ko38b9k8orkcb9o8gqjcb9.name: CVS Aetna Data Science Clinical Products Lunch and Learn
_64qjee248d1k4b9k6ko38b9k8orkcb9o8gqjcb9.description:
Heinz College:

Healthcare in America is ineffective and expensive. At Aetna, a CVS Company, we are using data science on primarily claims data to develop new products and innovative services to positively reshape chronic disease management. Our transformative models and cutting edge analytics have national outcomes that are benefiting the health of countless Americans.

For example, CVS’s new home dialysis program was incepted on our team and validated with analytics on Aetna’s claims data. This project is designed to delay the onset of end state renal disease, reduce hospitalizations, eliminate unnecessary emergency room visits, and lower patient healthcare costs. It’s working. We currently have patients on home dialysis due to our work.

Many more projects are in development. Some of the chronic conditions that we are currently working to mitigate are chronic kidney disease, diabetes, congestive heart failure, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

We are differentiated from other teams in CVS because we use claims data to underpin our modeling and analytics. The petabytes of data we leverage allow our neural nets, random forests, shap force plots, regressions, and other models to be more predictive and more externally valid than the models of our peers. Coupled with CVS’s national footprint our individualized models are fundamentally improving treatment outcomes and creating new ways to access healthcare. We are obsessed with making our members healthier.
We have a great team. Our data scientists are unparalleled. Our data engineers move mountains to productionalize models and incorporate nettlesome internet of things third-party data. We collaborate with our support team of nephrologists, endocrinologists, cardiologists, physicians, pharmacists, nurses, and more to ground our data science in the latest medical findings.
Why should you come to work at Aetna? CVS Health’s enterprise assets empower our team to make a health impact on the caliber of the federal government (and we move much faster). Our claims records combined with CVS’s data enables us to solve previously unanswerable questions; we have access to everything from candy bars purchases to electronic medical records. We have unrivaled data. Finally, we have a passionate team who is laser focused on making people healthier. We are changing how American’s manage their chronic diseases.

If you have the data scientist tool kit, coupled with either a passion for healthcare or the business expertise to execute cutting edge innovations, you want to be on our team.

Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist roles are based out of New York City-NY, Hartford -CT, and Wellesley-MA. All roles are on the Consumer Health and Services - Analytics and Behavior Change - Advanced Product team of Aetna, a CVS Company.

_8kqj2d1i69244b9o8gq4ab9k851jeba26kpk6ba.name: Jane Street - CSimathon! at CMU
_8kqj2d1i69244b9o8gq4ab9k851jeba26kpk6ba.description:
From the creators of the Estimathon, the mindbending mixture of math and trivia, comes the CStimathon!

October 10th @ 6pm ET
CMU, Rashid Auditorium - Gates Hillman 4401

Register as an individual or team by Oct 8th here:
https://www.janestreet.com/cstimathon-cmu.html

In teams, you'll attempt 13 problems in 30 minutes, challenging your trivial knowledge of computers, CMU, or anything at all. Be prepared to come up with the best set of confidence intervals! They are called Fermi problems, such as:

- How many computers were connected to the Internet on January 1, 1989?
- What is the bandwidth under the Atlantic Ocean?
- How many YouTube videos have more than 1 billion views?

55n2kqsjj8g2pfusn0i8nrvgb8.name: 5 Ways Intuit is Empowering Employees to Bring Their Whole Selves to Work
55n2kqsjj8g2pfusn0i8nrvgb8.description:
At Intuit, proud maker of TurboTax, QuickBooks and Mint, we strive to create an environment where everyone is supported and can bring their whole selves to work. We want employees with a wide range of life experiences to bring new ideas and perspectives to the table, so great ideas can rise to the top.

In this live webcast, our Chief Diversity and Inclusion Officer Scott Beth, will explain the importance of bringing one’s whole self to work, share Intuit’s Diversity and Inclusion strategy, join a group of Intuit employee panelists to learn how they have brought their whole selves to work, and answer any questions you may have.

No matter who you are, what your role is, or where you reside — we hope you are able to bring your whole self to work and are valued every single day.

6qad0lgi31mf5jf3s1labhckg8.description:
In 2008, OPPO launched its first mobile phone, the A103, nicknamed “Smiley Face”. This marked the beginning of a journey to explore and pioneer extraordinary technology. Today, OPPO showcases the beauty of technology to its global consumers through smart devices (with its core products being the Find and Reno series smartphones), ColorOS, and internet services such as OPPO Cloud and OPPO+.
OPPO has a presence in over 40 different countries and regions and has set up 6 research divisions and 4 R&D centers. OPPO has also established a global design center in London. Together, over 40,000 OPPO employees join their efforts to create a better life for all.
OPPO has established OPPO Research Institute, which incorporates 6 research divisions. OPPO also has 4 R &D centers globally.

Students can apply through link:http://job.lockinchina.com/network/1130.html

This event was jointly organized by Lockin China and OPPO to bring career opportunities to college talents. Lockin China is the largest global career development platform for young professionals in China. As of early 2018, Lockin China has more than 25,000 registered companies, providing more than 100,000 job opportunities. In the past three years, we have successfully helped over 500,000 global young talents from close to 1000 Universities to start their career in China job market.
Go through link: http://job.lockinchina.com/network/1130.html for application details.

33lqkcaei74a0top49e5t4rv0v.name: View - Info Sesh
33lqkcaei74a0top49e5t4rv0v.description:
In the great tradition of challenging the way we think about everyday essentials, the team at View has reinvented something that hasn't changed for centuries – the simple window – and in doing so, is transforming the largest industry in the world: real estate.
We manufacture View Dynamic Glass, a new generation of smart windows that let in natural light and views and enhance mental and physical wellbeing by significantly reducing headaches, eyestrain and drowsiness. In addition, View’s windows reduce glare and heat, improving the energy efficiency of buildings by 20 percent. View’s windows are digital, cloud connected, and can be controlled from anywhere, including your phone. We are also leveraging advances in AI to develop smart building and IoT applications that make buildings healthier, smarter and more productive than anyone ever imagined.
View is already installed in over 50 million square feet and is growing rapidly. If you dream of changing the world to make it a better place – join us.
